name: I'll Pop The Questions, You Pop The Corn Online Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: All of these actors have portrayed fictional U.S. presidents, except?
questions.explanation:
James Cagney.

	Jeff Bridges was the commander in chief in 'The Contender', Gene Hackman in 'Absolute Power', and Gregory Peck in 'Amazing Grace and Chuck'.

questions.text: 'Wuthering Heights', the 1939 film based on the Emily Bronte novel, starred what leading man and lady as Heathcliff and Catherine?
questions.explanation:
Laurence Olivier and Merle Oberon.

	It is the story of doomed love in preVictorian England and was also remade in 1953, 1970 and 1992.

questions.text: This actress was born Anna Maria Louisa Italiano. Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Anne Bancroft.

	She won an Oscar and a Tony in 1962 for her performance in 'The Miracle Worker' and is married to the zany Mel Brooks.

questions.text: What is the name of Marty McFly's (Michael J. Fox) rock band in the film 'Back To The Future'?
questions.explanation:
The Pinheads.

	They played 'The Power of Love' and one of the judges is Huey Lewis, whose group (Huey Lewis and the News) performs the song on the film's soundtrack.

questions.text: What was the name of the first bank successfully robbed by the title characters in the film, 'Bonnie and Clyde'?
questions.explanation:
The Mineola Bank.

	Arthur Penn's 1967 filmed starred Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway.

questions.text: 'New York Stories' consisted of three short films directed by Martin Scorcese, Francis Ford Coppola and what other director?
questions.explanation:
Woody Allen.

	It was released in 1989 and featured three New York stories by three New York directors.

questions.text: Ingrid Bergman won a Best Supporting Actress Award for her role in which film based on an Agatha Christie novel?
questions.explanation:
Murder on the Orient Express.

	Sidney Lumet directed the 1974 film which featured an all star international cast.

questions.text: What 1940 film inspired the Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan movie 'You've Got Mail'?
questions.explanation:
'The Shop Around the Corner'.

	James Stewart and Margaret Sullavan starred in the charming Ernst Lubitsch film.

questions.text: Paul Newman won a Best Actor Academy Award for his role as 'Fast Eddie' Felson in what film?
questions.explanation:
'The Color of Money'.

	He played 'Fast Eddie' in 'The Hustler', but won the coveted award many years later as the aging pool shark in 1986's 'The Color of Money'.

questions.text: What was the last feature film Elvis Presley starred in?
questions.explanation:
'Change of Habit'.

	Released in 1969, Mary Tyler Moore and Barbara McNair costarred with 'The King', who played a doctor.
